text:
This Is Us star Chrissy Metz rocked a burgundy latex dress to the MTV Movie and TV Awards Sunday night. She looked incredible, and she knew it—and refused to hear anything otherwise.

She wore the custom Jane Doe Latex dress to present the award for Best Duo alongside her costar, Milo Ventimiglia, and clearly upstaged him:

And that was even after she changed into a gorgeous blue dress for the Beauty and the Beast-themed opening number. Changing in and out of latex quickly? That deserves its own award.

Getty Images

But apparently, not everybody was too happy with Metz’s look, and snarked about her size online. But Metz has never had time for body shaming, and always promotes positivity no matter what your size. After the awards show wrapped, she went on Twitter and responded to the body shamers. “For the record, I wear what I want, when I want,” she wrote. “News flash it’s MY body. #thankstho.”

For the record, I wear what I want, when I want. News flash it's

MY body. #thankstho — Chrissy Metz (@ChrissyMetz) May 8, 2017

Those are words to live by—and hardly the first time she’s spoken out about feeling comfortable in her own skin. "Size doesn't equate to beauty. I don't understand why that's a thing,” she told Marie Claire back in March. “Well, I do, because the media has told us thin is beautiful. But is it?”
title: Chrissy Metz Does Not Have Time for Any MTV Awards Body Shaming
